titleInfo.title: Letter No. 8 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Secret Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the affairs of Bahrein [Bahrain], and the potential disposition of Abbass Pasha, Viceroy of Egypt [Wāli of Egypt and Sudan]. It states that the question as to whether the Pasha can or will control the ambitions of Ameer Fysul [Amīr Fayṣul], the Wahabee Chief [Wahabi], or will endorse his designs on Bahrein will be determined by the course of events. It also notes that Shaikh Mahomed bin Khuleefa [Muḥammed bin Khalīfah Āl Khalīfah], Chief of Bahrain, has abandoned his plans to attack the Al Ali tribe at sea.Enclosed with the item is a translated extract of a letter from Hajee Jassem, British Agent at Bahrein to the Resident in the Persian Gulf, dated 28 August 1853.The enclosure reports that Ameer Fysul has proclaimed a friendly disposition towards Bahrain; it notes that the Shaikhs of Bahrein are not convinced.
